title: Poland
excerpt: A country in Central Europe with a complex history
text: Poland is a country in Central Europe with a complex history spanning from medieval kingdoms to modern democracy. Warsaw, the capital, was largely destroyed during World War II and has been rebuilt as a modern city. Poland has a population of about 37 million and is known for its Solidarity movement, Marie Curie, and astronomer Copernicus. The country is located on the North European Plain and is known for its cultural heritage. Poland joined the European Union in 2004 and adopted the Euro in... (not yet, uses the Zloty). The country is known for its medieval architecture, including the castles of Wawel and Marienburg. Poland has a rich tradition of folk art, music, and literature.
